com.appboy
Interface IAppboy

All Known Implementing Classes:
Appboy
public interface IAppboy

The public interface for the Appboy SDK. This interface is used to send and receive data to and from Appboy.

Overview

To use this class properly, follow the pattern below:
  1. Add your Appboy API key to your AndroidManifest.xml file.
  2. Create an IAppboy instance by calling Appboy.getInstance(android.app.Activity).
  3. Call openSession() and closeSession() in your Activity's onStart() and onStop() respectively. 
   // Creating an IAppboy instance
   IAppboy appboy = Appboy.getInstance(this);
   
 
   // The Appboy API key is read from the AndroidManifest.xml file. Be sure to include the 'com.appboy.APPBOY_API_KEY'
   // (Constants.APPBOY_API_KEY) meta-data tag as a child of application element.
   <application android:icon="@drawable/icon" android:label="@string/app_name">
     <meta-data android:name="com.appboy.APPBOY_API_KEY" android:value="YOUR-API-KEY"/>
       ...
   </application>

Session Handling

It's imperative that you call IAppboy.openSession() and IAppboy.closeSession in every Activity. Check your AndroidManifest.xml file for the Activities defined in your app and be sure to configure those properly. The SDK operates around open sessions and calls to other SDK methods will fail without one. 
   
   @Override
   public void onStart() {
     super.onStart();
     // Opens a new Appboy session.
     Appboy.getInstance(this).openSession();
   }

   @Override
   public void onStop() {
     // Closes the Appboy session.
     Appboy.getInstance(this).closeSession();
     super.onStop();
   }

Note: For methods which return a boolean, a value of true only indicates that the resulting asynchronous operation (posting feedback to the server, reporting a custom event, updating a user attribute, etc.) was requested. Any failures in execution will happen asynchronously and not be revealed by the return value.

Method Detail

openSession

void openSession()
Opens a new session or resumes the previous session (if openSession is called within 10 seconds of closeSession). This must be called in the Activity's onStart method.

closeSession

void closeSession()
Closes the current session. The session may be reopened if a call is made to openSession() within 10 seconds. This must be called in the Activity's onStop method.

submitFeedback

boolean submitFeedback(java.lang.String replyToEmail,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       boolean isReportingABug)
Submits a piece of feedback to the Appboy feedback center so that it can be handled in the Appboy dashboard. The request to submit feedback is made immediately, however, this method does not block and will return as soon as the feedback request is placed on the network queue. Feedback submissions will also flush the session/events queue when the network request is actually made.

Parameters:
replyToEmail - The email address to send feedback replies to.
message - The message input by the user. Must be non-null and non-empty.
isReportingABug - Flag indicating whether or not the feedback describes a bug, or is merely a suggestion/question.
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the feedback item was successfully queued for delivery.

logCustomEvent

boolean logCustomEvent(java.lang.String eventName)
Reports a custom named event.

Parameters:
eventName - The String identifier for the event to track. Best practice is to track generic events useful for segmenting, instead of specific user actions (i.e. track watched_sports_video instead of watched_video_adrian_peterson_td_mnf).
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the event was successfully attached to the session (to be flushed later).

logPurchase

boolean logPurchase(java.lang.String productId,
                    int priceInCents)
Reports that the current user made an in app purchase. Useful for tracking and segmenting users more likely to make purchases.

Parameters:
productId - The String identifier for the product purchased. Usually the Google Play SKU.
priceInCents - The price paid. All calls to logPurchase should be normalized to a single currency for consistency in filtering across a user base.
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the event was successfully attached to the session (to be flushed later).

logShare

boolean logShare(SocialNetwork network)
Reports that the current user shared activity to a social network. Useful for tracking and segmenting social media influencers.

Parameters:
network - The network which the share was made on. For shares to multiple networks, call this method multiple times.
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the event was successfully attached to the session (to be flushed later).

refreshAll

void refreshAll()
Requests an immediate refresh of the news feed, slideup and server-side configuration from the Appboy server. All refresh requests also flush the session/events queue when the network request is actually made. Results of refresh calls are reported asynchronously via events. Events can be subscribed to with other methods in this class.

refreshSlideup

void refreshSlideup()
Requests an immediate refresh of only the slideup. Use this if you want to check for new slideup messages, but don't want to incur the overhead of pulling down an entire new message feed. All refresh requests also flush the session/events queue when the network request is actually made. Results of refresh calls are reported asynchronously via events. Events can be subscribed to with other methods in this class.

flushImmediately

void flushImmediately()
Requests an immediate flush of the session/events queue. Appboy will periodically report new sessions and events back to the server, however, if you have reason to immediately push new events up, you can do so with flushImmediately. Returns as soon as the flush is requested, doesn't block.

subscribeToFeedUpdates

void subscribeToFeedUpdates(IEventSubscriber<FeedUpdatedEvent> subscriber,
                            android.app.Activity activity)
Subscribes to a news feed event. The subscriber callback will be called when the news feed is updated. The subscriber will be called with a FeedUpdatedEvent. Subscriptions are associated with the activity and must be cleared by calling removeActivitySubscriptions(android.app.Activity)

Parameters:
subscriber - A callback that should be executed when the news feed is updated.
activity - The active activity.

subscribeToNewSlideups

void subscribeToNewSlideups(IEventSubscriber<SlideupEvent> subscriber,
                            android.app.Activity activity)
Subscribes to a news Slideup event. The subscriber callback will be called when the a new slideup is sent. The subscriber will be called with a SlideupEvent. Subscriptions are associated with the activity and must be cleared by calling removeActivitySubscriptions(android.app.Activity)

Parameters:
subscriber - A callback that should be executed when the news feed is updated.
activity - The active activity.

removeActivitySubscriptions

void removeActivitySubscriptions(android.app.Activity activity)
Removes all subscribers associated with the activity. Best practice is to put this in Activity.onStop()

Parameters:
activity - The activity to which the subscribers are registered.

setFirstName

void setFirstName(java.lang.String firstName)
Sets the first name of the user. Used to collect information about the user.

Parameters:
firstName - The first name of the user.

Sets the last name of the user. Used to collect information about the user.

Parameters:

Parameters:

Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the email address is valid

setBio

void setBio(java.lang.String bio)
Sets a biography for the user. Used to collect information about the user.

Parameters:
bio - A biography describing the user.

setGender

void setGender(Gender gender)
Sets the gender for the user. Used to collect information about the user.

Parameters:
gender - Gender enum representing the user's gender.

setDateOfBirth

boolean setDateOfBirth(java.lang.String dateOfBirth)
Sets the date of birth of the user. The required format is yyyy-mm-dd. Used to collect information about the user.

Parameters:
dateOfBirth - The date of birth of the user.
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the date of birth is of form yyyy-mm-dd.

Parameters:
country - The country of the user.

Parameters:

Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the phone number passed basic validation

setCustomUserAttribute

void setCustomUserAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.String value)
Sets a custom user attribute. This can be any key/value pair and is used to collect extra information about the user.

Parameters:
key - The identifier of the custom attribute
value - The value of the custom attribute
